Strong analytic and data management skills
Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team is essential
Ability to work well with individuals at all levels within the institution
Ability to appropriately scope and execute evaluation and analysis work

Title: Applied ML Engineer
Description:
Deep subject matter expertise in machine learning, especially in NLP and speech recognition.
As part of the team, you will be working with an exceptional group…
Descriptions:
The Company
We're taking the best parts of in-person team collaboration, and making them even better in the remote-first world. We're starting by building a unique real-time collaboration layer for remote sales teams. On our virtual sales floor, sales representatives can work together while prospecting, emailing and calling customers.
Teams like Gong, Modern Health, and Robin are using Nooks to recreate the in-office experience during daily co-working sessions.
It's helped them:
on average, book 60% more meetings
retain 30% more reps AND managers
reach activity numbers to hit quota
The pandemic made sales lonely. Help us make it a team sport again!
Why ML?
Sales reps spend their day scouting for prospects & making hundreds of personalized emails, videos and cold calls. Nooks tries to inject collaboration into their workday — but only when it matters.
We want reps to listen to each other's cold calls — but only when they're talking to a qualified client, not when they're hitting an answering machine or dial tree for the 20th time.
We want reps to collaborate on the high-level talking points they use in emails — but without having to review every single email their colleagues send out.
That's where the Nooks Data Engine comes into play. We use speech recognition, NLP, and active learning to intelligently surface portions of calls and emails that others should pay attention to. Most importantly, we do this real-time, making collaboration and learning effortless.
Role Responsibilities
As part of the team, you will be working with an exceptional group of skilled software engineers and ML / data scientists. You will own problems end-to-end, and use your knowledge and creativity to solve them using data. The code you write will impact remote sales teams and enable them to work faster and more efficiently.
You'll also contribute to brainstorming sessions on ML projects, and work with the Product team to shape Nooks's future features and product roadmap.
Requirements
Deep subject matter expertise in machine learning, especially in NLP and speech recognition
2+ years of experience working with data at scale or deploying ML models in production environments
Good communication skills, including an ability to articulately convey the benefits and drawbacks of various approaches
Experience with deep learning frameworks: Pytorch or Tensorflow
Ability to articulate design and implementation details to find the best solution
Ability to iterate quickly on ideas
Focus on delivering results in an environment with important deadlines and multiple priorities
Bonus if you have ...
Previously published research papers in machine learning or artificial intelligence
Set up cloud infrastructure for data pipelines or production models in AWS, GCP, or Azure
A GitHub profile or personal website showcasing previous projects and experiences
Location
Remote or San Francisco
Know someone that would be the perfect fit for these role? Refer someone we hire and get a $2k referral bonus.


About Nooks
We're an early-stage startup with 10+ team members and experience from Stanford, Berkeley, Facebook, Google, Amazon, McKinsey, Tesla Autopilot, and Scale AI. We're well-funded with $5M from top-tier investors.
We have an HQ in San Francisco, but our team is spread across the world from Argentina to Estonia. We use Nooks ourselves internally to build a strong remote-first culture and we'd love for you to join us on our journey!

Title: Senior Director, Data Science
Description:
10+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, data science and/or machine learning.
Recruit great data scientists, data engineers and data analysts, in…
Descriptions:
Hotel Engine is the world's largest Lodging Performance Network, established to create a richer, more rewarding business travel experience by connecting a global network of businesses and lodging partners. Our innovative travel-tech company is on an incredible growth trajectory and will continue to build on our strong foundations by bringing our customer obsession, data-driven problem-solving, and bias for action into every decision we make.
Following a 2021 series B funding round at a $1.3 billion valuation, we achieved remarkable growth in 2022. We expect 2023 to be our best year yet
Working hard behind the scenes building and supporting our platform are exceptional people–from our large engineering and product teams to our fast-growing sales, supplier, and member support orgs, to our data, marketing, and operations teams.
We value our individuality, and we also understand that together, we thrive. Most importantly, we know we're not for everyone! We're focused on finding the right people who are energized by our culture, with diverse experiences and backgrounds that will help us unlock our full potential. Complacency doesn't live here. We've built a team of world-class people who really want to work with other world-class people. Click here to view our DNA, and if you like what you see, please, read on!
We are looking for a Senior Director to take a leadership role on our Data Engineering and Data Science team and support our fast growth. This is a key technical leadership role with executive-level visibility, a finger on the pulse of the overall business, and broad impact for someone who exhibits intellectual curiosity and rigor, and a capacity of execution to tackle some of the most critical technical challenges that span the breadth of our business.
Reporting to our VP of Data Engineering and Data Science, you will grow and lead a team of data scientists, data engineers and data analysts, and will act as both a people and technical thought leader. If you are passionate about travel, about working on both strategic projects and hands-on implementation, and relate to our vision and DNA, please apply.

Here's what you'll do:
Develop and lead a data team strongly integrated with product and engineering and with company-wide stakeholders including sales, marketing, supplier relations, traveler experience, and finance
Partner with product, engineering, and other cross-functional leaders to drive analytics and insights-driven decision making throughout the business
Work with the VP of Data to develop, obtain support and execute on a short, medium, and long-term data roadmap and strategy. Lead quarterly and monthly planning process, as well as weekly sprints
Recruit great data scientists, data engineers and data analysts, in collaboration with Hotel Engine's recruiting team. Mentor the professional development of direct reports, managers, and individual contributors, through coaching and performance management. Build diverse and distributed teams and collaborative environments.
Act as though leader for the team's work on product analytics and experimentation, modeling and predictive analytics, data privacy and security and drive the overall data strategy for the company.
Ensure that the team builds and maintains world-class data pipelines, data warehouse, and business intelligence and analytics solutions.
Design, built, synthesize and present robust analyses aimed at driving the strategic direction of Hotel Engine
Lead the development of predictive algorithms based on principles from statistics, machine learning and operations research to power and improve product features, increase customer engagement and satisfaction, deliver efficiency gains throughout the business, and support better decision making
Work with product and engineering to deploy ML-based solutions into production
Working closely with cross-functional stakeholders to define, track and report core business and product metrics and KPIs to inform both strategic decisions and day-to-day business operations
Identify new opportunities to leverage data to improve HE's products and processes and help our business
Work with product and engineering to define and capture key metrics for our new products and identify causal impact through experimentation and causal inference methods

Here's what we're looking for:
10+ years of relevant experience in data analytics, data science and/or machine learning. At least 6 years as an individual contributor and at least 4 years leading a data team
A PhD or MS in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Sciences or Engineering)
Expert knowledge of a scientific computing language (such as Python or R) and SQL
Expertise in statistics and machine learning, and a history of empowering whole organizations to use data by making data robust, well-structured, and as self-serve as possible Leadership experience in an analytical role at a growth-stage company
Track record of recruiting and leading high-performing data teams
Effective communication skills both in written (memos, emails, decks) and verbal form
Proven ability to lead projects to completion and collaborate seamlessly with others
You are a self-starter, able to operate effectively and with autonomy in a fast-paced environment with a high level of ambiguity, and you have experience building productive and positive relationships across an organization at all levels (entry level to senior executives)
Track record of rigorous execution and high impact
Highly detailed-oriented and exceptional organizational and follow-through skills is a must

Cash Compensation:
In addition to a compelling equity package, a reasonable expectation for total cash compensation for this role is between $180,000 - $230,000/year (made up of base plus bonus). Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including prior experience, expertise, and may vary from the amount above.

Remote opportunities:
This role is eligible for remote work, and you can work from anywhere in the U.S.
Hotel Engine Total Rewards Philosophy | We recognize that there is more to work than day-to-day responsibilities. Hotel Engine has been recognized on Built-in Colorado's Best Places to Work list 3 years in a row (2020-2022) for our positive culture and robust growth opportunities.
As a company, we're also dedicated to giving back to our greater community, and have comprehensive corporate social responsibility programs supporting community, social justice and environmental causes. In addition to a collaborative, high-performing team environment, we're pleased to offer benefits including:
Competitive base salaries
Annual performance bonuses
Stock options for all associates + performance-based stock options
Insurance benefits including medical coverage (with a plan available at no cost to employees) + 100% paid dental and vision insurance
401(k) plan with a match program
Unlimited PTO + 2 paid days each year to volunteer with your favorite non-profit
Paid parental leave and family medical leave
Hotel discounts through our exclusive platform
The ability to make a real impact in an incredibly fast-growing organization; you'll never be just another cog in the wheel.

Title: Senior Data Scientist | Bankrate
Description: Provide guidance to the broader data science community within RV on the design and execution of the data science projects, especially when relevant to expertise…
Descriptions:
Red Ventures' Financial Services industry group is looking for a senior data scientist to join our team. As a member of our team, you'll be empowered to develop data science solutions from ideation all the way to putting your solution into production and seeing the real impact it has on our business. Our solutions aim to improve the financial journeys of the users who interact with our websites and digital products. We welcome candidates from different backgrounds and believe that diverse, inclusive teams are better teams.
What You'll Do:
Design and execute multi-disciplinary data science solutions effectively and efficiently.
Partner with business leaders and work effectively across business, creative, and engineering groups to solve problems. Help build a positive culture across technical and business teams.
Provide guidance to the broader data science community within RV on the design and execution of the data science projects, especially when relevant to expertise.
Further the data science team's technical capabilities by bringing novel methods from the field into RV through research, software development, and teaching others.
Drive the development of junior team members through mentorship and coaching.
Help create and promote an inclusive environment where team members feel comfortable and empowered.
What We're Looking For:
4+ yrs of professional experience in a data science role with an MS or PhD in STEM with a focus in ML, statistical modeling, or optimization.
Knowledge of end-to-end software development, deployment, and monitoring workflows.
Ability to methodically understand business context, define value propositions, and formulate and solve complex data science problems.
Ability to clearly articulate the "why" behind proposed data science solutions to the relevant stakeholders.
Ability to own key deliverables and use problem solving to deliver projects on time and iterate when justified by potential, incremental value.
Ability to intake business requests/priorities and then prioritize bodies of work, communicating project status, timeline, and technical results to broad audiences.
Proficiency in one or multiple literate statistical programming languages such as R, Python, and Scala. Our data science team primarily builds production algorithms in python, but we are open to candidates with different backgrounds.
Experience expanding the knowledge of a data science team on topics where you have specific expertise through teaching and mentoring.
Experience leveraging technical expertise to identify the feasibility of potential data science projects, ensuring the team is delivering value on projects that are feasible.
Experience developing skills specific to a specialization or expertise through research skills like literature reviews and communication of findings.
Who We Are:
Over the last twenty years, Red Ventures has built a portfolio of influential brands, digital platforms, and strategic partnerships that work together to connect millions of people with expert advice. Through premium content and personalized digital experiences, Red Ventures builds online journeys that make it easier for people to make important decisions about their homes, health, travel, finances, education and entertainment. Founded in 2000, Red Ventures has 3,000 employees in 10 cities across the US, as well as in the UK and Brazil. Red Ventures owns and operates several large digital brands including Healthline, The Points Guy, Bankrate, MYMOVE, and Allconnect.com. For more information, visit https://redventures.com and follow @RedVentures on social platforms.
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, 401(k) plan and a paid parental leave program.
Red Ventures is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at Red Ventures is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications.
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with disabilities. This includes providing reasonable accommodation where appropriate. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to apply or participate in the job application or interview process, please contact accommodation@redventures.com.
Compensation:
Cash Compensation Range: $100,000 - $185,000*
Note actual salary is based on geographic location, qualifications, and experience.
Additionally, the following benefits are provided by Red Ventures, subject to eligibility requirements.
Health Insurance Coverage (medical, dental, and vision)
Life Insurance
Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts
Paid Time Off
Holiday Pay
401(k) with match
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Parental Bonding Benefit Program

Title: SENIOR DATA ANALYST
Description: Possesses a deep understanding of how data is created and transformed through the UniGroup ecosystem to drive business operations, customer experience, service…
Descriptions:
The Senior Data Analyst is part of a core team that enables strategic decision making throughout the company. Strong verbal and written communication, with time management skills are key to success in this role. This role will be able to consume, process and analyze the largest household goods datasets in the world in collaboration with other analysts, investigators, and subject matter experts. The right candidate should be passionate about data and analytics with a positive and solution-oriented mindset.

The work location for this role is flexible if approved by UniGroup except this position may not be performed remotely from Colorado or California.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Advocates for improvements to data quality, security, and query performance that have impact across your data domain.
Approves data model changes as a reviewer and code owner for specific data domains.
Builds actionable insight for the business using data visualization tools. (We use QlikSense and ThoughtSpot)
Builds close relationships with other functional teams to truly democratize data understanding and access.
Cleans and models large quantities of raw, disorganized data using code-based tools. (We leverage DBT)
Clearly and concisely communicates complex business logic, technical requirements, and design recommendations through iterative solutions.
Collaborates on SQL code base, creating analysis and transformations. Knowledge of Python, SAS, and various modeling techniques is preferred. (We use Snowflake and BI tools like Qlik and ThoughtSpot)
Collaborates with business units across UniGroup in building self-service, dashboard, and reporting solutions to deliver useful analysis and strong data insights.
Confidently delivers and explains data analytics methodologies and improvements with minimal guidance and support from other team members. Collaborate with the team on larger projects.
Contributes to, implements, and maintains best practices and standards in functional areas (data warehousing, data modeling, coding, visualization, and analysis) keeping reliability, performance, scalability, security, automation, and versioning in mind.
Effectively communicates and collaborates, including providing clear status updates.
Engages in discussions of technical design and architecture recommendations.
Explains trends across data sources, potential opportunities for growth or improvement, and data peculiarities to deliver descriptive, diagnostic, predictive, forecasting, and prescriptive data analysis.
Follows and improves processes and workflows for maintaining high quality data and reporting.
Helps to define and improve our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for our data environment. Maintains and advocates these standards through code review.
Implements data quality tests and continuously review, optimize, and refactor data models in order to expand our data environments with ready to analyze data.
Influences and implements service level framework SLOs and SLAs for data sources and data services.
Influences overall objectives and long-range goals of team.
Owns the end to end process of being on-call including reading logs, diagnosing issues, verifying and implementing solutions, and otherwise providing data support for UniGroup team members.
Participates in data quality process and other data auditing activities.
Proactively works on the efficiency and capacity planning to set clear requirements and reduce the system resources usage to make compute queries cheaper.
Provides mentorship for Junior and Intermediate Data Analysts on your team to help them grow in their technical responsibilities and remove blockers to their autonomy.
Solves technical problems of high scope and complexity.
Turns learnings into repeatable actions by documenting work in the appropriate shared location.
Performs a variety of other duties as assigned.
Education, License or Certification:
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Communications, Psychology, Business or equivalent experience.
Experience:
3-6 years of experience as a Business/Data Analyst or in related field
Minimum 6 years of experience with SQL writing required
Comfortable working in a highly agile, iterative environment using Jira.
Ability to work with Git and the command line preferred
Experience with a variety of data sources. (Our data includes many custom and internal applications, as well as Google Analytics, HubSpot, and more.)
Significant experience in SQL and DBT required
Experience with performance and optimization problems, particularly at large scale, and a demonstrated ability to both diagnose and prevent those problems.
Familiarity with relational and non-relational databases.
Knowledgeable about UniGroup’s architecture, APIs, and tech stake.
Possesses a deep understanding of how data is created and transformed through the UniGroup ecosystem to drive business operations, customer experience, service usage, and data reporting capabilities.
Project experience working with SQL, Python, R, or other methods to generate insights.
Self-motivated, and self-managing, with strong organizational skills.
Understand the code base extremely well to lead new data innovation and to spot inconsistencies and edge cases.
Understands the full data lifecycle and our common frameworks so that data can be easily integrated, modeled, and analyzed for insights.
We foster diversity, in part, by imposing a strict policy of non-discrimination. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, religion, disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or other status protected by the law.

We value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and separated service members bring to our workforce. While serving our country you have gained skills such as leadership, flexibility, and agility, which will help to make you successful here. We are dedicated to supporting military families and ensuring that we provide a welcoming environment for our country’s heroes. We hope you consider joining the UniGroup family.

UniGroup is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, UniGroup will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact careers@unigroup.com

Title: Sr. Data Engineer
Description:
Create data products for analytics and data scientist team members to improve their productivity.
This role requires deep understanding of data architecture,…
Descriptions:
Job Description:
SR. DATA ENGINEER

OVERVIEW:

Do you want to impact our future through data, analytics and innovative technology? Do you thrive on leading big things and making it happen? Bring your passion, expertise and problem-solving skills to the table and make an impact.
General Mills is reshaping the future, and technology & data play an important role for us. Your technology experience will help us get the right data and solutions at the right time, every time. As one of the world’s leading food companies, General Mills operates across the globe with more than 100 recognizable consumer brands, including: Cheerios, LÄRABAR, Pillsbury, Yoplait, Annie’s Homegrown, Totino’s, Epic Provisions and Blue Buffalo.

As a Sr. Data Engineer, you will work closely with a multidisciplinary agile team to build high quality data pipelines driving analytic solutions. These solutions will generate insights from our connected data, enabling General Mills to advance the data-driven decision-making capabilities of our enterprise. This role requires deep understanding of data architecture, data engineering, data analysis, reporting, and a basic understanding of data science techniques and workflows.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data architecture and pipelines that adhere to ETL principles and business goals.
Design, create, code, and support a variety of ETL solutions (potentially including but not limited to: Talend Studio, Python, Scala, Kafka, Google Big Query, or others)
Solve complex data problems to deliver insights that helps our business to achieve their goals
Create data products for analytics and data scientist team members to improve their productivity
Advise, consult, mentor and coach other data and analytic professionals on data standards and practices
Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale stability, and operational efficiency of data and analytical solutions
Lead evaluation, implementation, and deployment of emerging tools & process for analytic data engineering to improve our productivity as a team
Develop and deliver communication & education plans on analytic data engineering capabilities, standards, and processes
Partner with business analysts and solutions architects to develop technical architectures for strategic enterprise projects and initiatives.
Learn about machine learning, data science, computer vision, artificial intelligence, statistics, and/or applied mathematics

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree
5 years of experience working in data engineering or architecture role
Expertise in SQL and data analysis and experience with at least one programming language
Experience developing and maintaining data warehouses in Cloud or other large scale data platforms
Data Engineering experience using Google Cloud Platform or another Cloud environment
Experience with BigQuery, Python, Spark, and familiarity with Kafka
Experience working with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Shiny
Conceptual knowledge of data and analytics, such as dimensional modeling, ETL, reporting tools, data governance, data warehousing, structured and unstructured data.
Exposure to machine learning, data science, computer vision, artificial intelligence, statistics, and/or applied mathematics
Passion for agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and experimentation
Experience working on a collaborative agile product team
Excellent communication, listening, and influencing skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or Engineering
7+ years applicable work experience
Experience with developing solutions on cloud computing services and infrastructure in the data and analytics space
Experience in Python or Scala
Experience working with BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Shiny
Familiarity with the Linux operating system
Exposure to machine learning, data science, computer vision, artificial intelligence, statistics, and/or applied mathematics
Experience with OLAP such as AtScale, SSAS, SAP BW, Essbase
Knowledge of Data Preparation, Data Wrangling, and Feature Engineering

ADDITIONAL CONSIDERATIONS
The preferred location for this role is Minneapolis, MN however remote work-at-home applications within the United States will be considered.
Relocation support will not be offered to applicants within the United States.
International relocation or international remote working arrangements (outside of the US) will not be considered.
Company Overview:
We exist to make food the world loves. But we do more than that. Our company is a place that prioritizes being a force for good, a place to expand learning, explore new perspectives and reimagine new possibilities, every day. We look for people who want to bring their best — bold thinkers with big hearts who challenge one other and grow together. Because becoming the undisputed leader in food means surrounding ourselves with people who are hungry for what’s next.

The FBM Program is experiencing significant growth and we need your expertise to deliver amazing new technologies to our customers while maintaining the technical requirements of the strategic deterrence.

Learn about the Trident II D5 Fleet Ballistic Missile.

To promote the sharing of ideas, Lockheed Martin cultivates an inclusive work environment that inspires differences and big-picture thinking.

Strong working knowledge of basic statistical concepts such as point estimation, probability distributions, hypothesis tests, and how they can be applied
Ability to implement algorithms into software to train systems to recognize patterns and perform specific functions
Active Secret clearance with the ability to obtain a Top Secret clearance

Strong verbal and written communication skills, including the communication of findings and their relevance in business terms

Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise and actionable manner

Description: Use machine learning and deep learning techniques (like logistic regression, outlier detection, decision trees, natural language processing, clustering, deep…
Descriptions:
Job Family: Data Warehousing and Business Information
Type: Full time
Date Posted: Nov 21, 2022
Req #: JR33573

Description
Business Information Developer Consultant Senior – Data Scientist
Location: Remote. Ideal candidates will live within 50 miles of Elevance Health’s PulsePoint locations
The Business Information Developer Consultant Senior - Data Scientist position will lead the development and implementation of predictive modeling algorithms and techniques to find patterns and trends to provide insights around Payment Integrity Incentives Program.
How you will make an impact:
Uses SQL programming languages to extract and manipulate large data sets.
Develops analytic solutions or base queries using Teradata SQL Assistant, SAS and Hive against healthcare data warehouse.
Uses R and Python to develop predictive models for theorizing and forecasting. PowerBI and Tableau for data visualizations.
Will be creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques (regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, properties of distributions, statistical tests etc).
Monitors project schedules and costs.
Conducts training on use of applications developed.
This job is focused on spending time thinking about programming and how it would be used to design solutions.
Minimum Requirements:
Requires a BS/BA degree and a minimum of 6 years experience; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background.
Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences :
Expert level PC, MS office tools, and database skills, as well as experience in standard business Information tools and SQL programming/query languages highly preferred.
Proven experience in SAS and MS SQL connecting to databases like Teradata, SQL Server, and Oracle (uses SQL programming languages to extract and manipulate large data sets) highly preferred.
Experience with SAS EG, R, Python, PowerBI and Tableau highly preferred
Proven experience in developing algorithms and data models to forecast outcomes preferred.
Use machine learning and deep learning techniques (like logistic regression, outlier detection, decision trees, natural language processing, clustering, deep learning, and classification) to find patterns and trends in datasets to uncover insights preferred.
Ability to communicate findings through visualizations and reports effectively with multi-disciplinary audiences and multiple levels within the organization preferred.
Proven ability to collaborate in team tasks to produce complex analyses on a rigorous schedule preferred.
Healthcare insurance knowledge/experience preferred.
For candidates working in person or remotely in the below locations, the salary* range for this specific position is $105,920 to $190,656
Locations: Colorado; Nevada, Jersey City, NJ; New York City, NY; Ithaca, NY and Westchester County, NY

Creating innovative financial operations solutions that help small and mid-size businesses save time, become more efficient and grow.
BILL is a leader in financial automation software for small and midsize businesses (SMBs). As a champion of SMBs, we are dedicated to automating the future of finance so businesses can flourish. Hundreds of thousands of businesses trust BILL solutions to manage financial workflows, including payables, receivables, and spend and expense management. With BILL, businesses are connected to a network of millions of members, so they can pay or get paid faster. BILL is a trusted partner of leading U.S. financial institutions, accounting firms, and accounting software providers. We have operations in San Jose, CA, Draper, UT, Houston, TX and Sydney, AUS and are continuing to expand into other geographic locations. Title: Senior Data Consultant, Account Manager - Life Science - Remote
Description: In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock…
Descriptions:
Combine two of the fastest-growing fields on the planet with a culture of performance, collaboration and opportunity and this is what you get. Leading edge technology in an industry that is improving the lives of millions. Here, innovation is not about another gadget; it is about making health care data available wherever and whenever people need it, safely and reliably. There is no room for error. If you are looking for a better place to use your passion and your desire to drive change, this is the place to be. It's an opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Optum combines data, technology, and expertise to power modern health care. The Data & Advanced Analytic Tools Consulting team drives the adoption and use of technology solutions by managing, growing and developing relationships with research, scientific, and commercial leaders at life sciences companies through the use of Optum’s data assets and technology applications.
Optum's industry-leading data assets include clinically-robust Electronic Health Record (EHR) data spanning the care continuum (from the legacy Humedica business), eligibility-controlled affiliate and non-affiliate insurance claims data, a new class of deterministically-linked Integrated EHR and claims data, and linked profile data including socio-economic information and health risk assessments (HRAs). Optum’s data assets enable our clients to enrich their view of the patient and the patient journey through the healthcare system, serving needs across a spectrum of functional areas including real world evidence, health economics and outcomes research, safety and surveillance, epidemiology, and product commercialization.
Optum’s advanced analytic tools empower our clients to harness intelligence from these data assets with scale. Our wealth of data and tool solutions, combined with our industry expertise, is uncovering novel insights and driving real world change.
We’re now looking for a dynamic Senior Consultant to support Data & Advanced Analytic Tools, working closely with our clients across the industry.
You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely* from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.
Primary Responsibilities:
Evaluate data to support and develop client relationships: listen, understand, and articulate client needs
Collaborate to solve unique and complex problems with impact spanning from team operations to business needs
Implement solutions that meet client needs
Partner with internal team members on cross functional client engagements
Work across teams to create use case studies and business proposals
Participate in the development of business strategy for assigned client accounts
Predict emerging client analytics needs and participate in the development of innovative solutions to meet those needs
Interact with other departments, such as sales, operations and others, to ensure high levels of client satisfaction through successful execution of data licenses and use of applications and data
Work in a cohesive partnership with Directors of Data Engagement on assigned key clients and collaborate with other teams within the Optum family

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree with 2+years of professional experience (or graduate degree with 1+ years professional experience) Professional experience must be in: life sciences industry, healthcare field, or life sciences management consulting
1+ years of experience supporting client or large projects for internal/external customers, preferably in the life sciences industry
1+ years of experience with patient-level healthcare data (claims, EHR, pharma,etc.) to support internal and external clients
1+ years of experience evaluating data to present findings based on business deliverable/requirements (role is client facing role, not data analysis role)
Experience presenting to a variety of stakeholders thru various media
Experience working across clients and supporting other team members in fulfillment of data and advanced analytics responsibilities
Solid understanding of Powerpoint and Excel (Powerpoint must be able to create and modify PPT’s) (EXCEL must be able to create spreadsheet, pivot tables, linking cells with little to no supervision)
Travel required up to 25%
Full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential job function of this role. Candidates located in states that mandate COVID-19 booster doses must also comply with those state requirements. UnitedHealth Group will adhere to all federal, state and local regulations as well as all client requirements and will obtain necessary proof of vaccination, and boosters when applicable, prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation
Preferred Qualifcation:
SQL or R

To protect the health and safety of our workforce, patients and communities we serve, UnitedHealth Group and its affiliate companies require all employees to disclose COVID-19 vaccination status prior to beginning employment. In addition, some roles and locations require full COVID-19 vaccination, including boosters, as an essential job function. UnitedHealth Group adheres to all federal, state and local COVID-19 vaccination regulations as well as all client COVID-19 vaccination requirements and will obtain the necessary information from candidates prior to employment to ensure compliance. Candidates must be able to perform all essential job functions with or without reasonable accommodation. Failure to meet the vaccination requirement may result in rescission of an employment offer or termination of employment
Careers with Optum. Here's the idea. We built an entire organization around one giant objective; make health care work better for everyone. So when it comes to how we use the world's large accumulation of health-related information, or guide health and lifestyle choices or manage pharmacy benefits for millions, our first goal is to leap beyond the status quo and uncover new ways to serve. Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, brings together some of the greatest minds and most advanced ideas on where health care has to go in order to reach its fullest potential. For you, that means working on high performance teams against sophisticated challenges that matter. Optum, incredible ideas in one incredible company and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)
Colorado, Connecticut or Nevada Residents Only: The salary range for Colorado residents is $82,100 to $146,900. The salary range for Connecticut / Nevada residents is $90,500 to $161,600. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.
*All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.
UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

Title: Senior Data Scientist

Descriptions:
What We Do: AI Service Management (AISM):
Aisera offers the world's first AI-driven service experience solution that automates operations and support for IT, Sales and customer service, making businesses and customers successful by offering consumer-like self-service resolutions to users. Aisera fast tracks the digital transformation journey with user and service behavioral intelligence that drives end-to-end automation of tasks, actions, and business processes. Great communicator. You have experience writing clear, concise, and detailed documentation

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Product
Description:
Defining technical units of work for other 1-2 data engineers at Pathrise and manage data initiatives to success.
️Medical, Dental & Vision benefits.
Descriptions:
What is Pathrise?
Pathrise (YC W18) connects job seekers across North America to world class industry mentorship and career coaching to help them land a new career. The program is free upfront and our customers pay us back when they’re hired.

Built around aligned incentives, we help build equity in the job search process by providing 1-on-1 mentorship, training, and a platform to uplift job seekers and ultimately, help them fulfill their hopes, ambitions, and livelihoods. We’ve already helped more than a thousand fellows land meaningful jobs, and helped them earn over $100M in salary.

Last year, we raised our Series A and there is even more exciting growth on the horizon. In 2022, we have already expanded from 6 to 14 industries, launched a tiered pricing system with differentiated product offerings, and much more.

Our Mission
Our mission is to help people everywhere build their careers by being the world’s best career agency.

We believe the job search system is broken and can be fixed with a business model that acts on behalf of the job seeker, instead of on behalf of employers, recruiters, or schools. If this sounds interesting to you, we look forward to hearing from you!

Read more about our mission in our manifesto.

The Role
Pathrise is looking for a Senior Data Analyst - Product to join our expanding data team. This role will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer and Co-Founder and will work closely with other members of the entire product and growth organization. At Pathrise, our product organization contains three top level departments:
Platform: Powers the technical infrastructure and software for the Pathrise Program
Career: Provides coaching on a weekly basis to our fellows in our program
Program: Builds and designs best-in-class service offerings to our fellows
We’re looking for a generalist that can work across a variety of data engineering and analytics domains. You can expect to work cross-functionally across these three teams to identify and execute on opportunities where data-driven insights results in company-wide impact. You’ll have the opportunity to work on everything from conducting analysis on identifying key program metrics that improve job-seekers placements, driving key technical decisions on our data infrastructure, to managing and coaching other data contributors.
Given the breadth of the role, this role is perfect for someone who values growth and has an entrepreneurial drive.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with internal partners to: identify, define, and clarify business requirements; translating needs into efficient reports and configurations that conform to standard methodologies and provide data driven insights
Own analytics needs across the product with a focus on transformation (dbt) and reporting (metabase) for descriptive and diagnostic analytics
Defining technical units of work for other 1-2 data engineers at Pathrise and manage data initiatives to success
Develop and execute on initiatives that improve reliability and trust in data reporting
Contribute to documentation, QA, and organization of our analytics tooling
Required Qualifications
6+ years of experience, leveraging descriptive data techniques for a product or growth team or similar adjacent spaces
Experience with SQL and Python or other data centric development languages
Experience with BI and Product Analytics tools like Metabase and Mixpanel
Experience focused on feature and usage metrics, funnel analysis, conversion and retention, as well as segmentation metrics
An ability to uncover data insights to form hypothesis, designing product experiments, evaluating results and making recommendations
A passion for working with people, able to ask questions, pinpoint issues, and proactively solve for them
Understand and can tell the story that connects the data back to the business metrics and their impact on the customers and business.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with tools in our current data stack (DBT, Fivetran, BigQuery, Segment, Metabase, Mixpanel)
Frontend development proficiency
Front end web development skills (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
Experience with forecasting and predictive analytics
Benefits & Compensation
$120k - 160k annual compensation + equity
✈️ Fully remote with company sponsored trips to yearly company events (Lake Tahoe in 2021, we're headed to Denver this year!)
️Medical, Dental & Vision benefits
Twice-yearly Performance Bonuses
Flexible Unlimited PTO and flexible working hours
❤️‍ Professional Development & Wellness Stipends
‍ WFH office stipend
Our culture
We are a tight-knit community that champions for our staff to bring their authentic true selves to work and aim to provide a fun and collaborative work environment for everyone. Although we are remote we have many virtual and company sponsored in-person events. We also value diversity - our Growth team includes many contributors from different backgrounds and exemplifies what Pathrise stands for externally as well as internally. Read more about how we aim to create a diverse and inclusive environment: What DE&I means to Pathrise ❤️

Pathrise is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. Pathrise does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by Company policy. Pathrise also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, Pathrise will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

If you are also interested in the fellowship, please apply here: https://www.pathrise.com/apply.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description: Expertise in developing or applying predictive analytics, statistical modeling, data mining, or machine learning algorithms, especially at scale.
Descriptions:
Machine Learning Engineer

Truveta is the world's first health provider led data platform with a vision of Saving Lives with Data. Our mission is to enable researchers to find cures faster, empower every clinician to be an expert, and help families make the most informed decisions about their care. Achieving Truveta' s ambitious vision requires an incredible team of talented and inspired people with a special combination of health, software and big data experience who share our company values.

Our headquarters are in the greater Seattle area but we celebrate and embrace a remote culture.

Who We Need
Truveta is rapidly building a talented and diverse team to tackle complex health and technical challenges. Beyond core capabilities, we are seeking problem solvers, passionate and collaborative teammates, and those willing to roll up their sleeves while making a difference. If you are interested in the opportunity to pursue purposeful work, join a mission-driven team, and build a rewarding career while having fun, Truveta may be the perfect fit for you.

This Opportunity
We are looking for an ML/NLP expert who can apply deep applied science and software development skills in building our AI systems. As an ML/NLP engineer you would work in an exciting and fast-paced environment, collaborating closely with multiple teams across the company and external research institutions. You will work as part of an organization that brings together talent in software, health, big data, machine learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and responsible AI towards accomplishing our mission. We value and encourage diversity in the belief that our differences make us and our products better.
We expect the candidate to:
Innovate in applying SOTA Natural Language Processing, Artificial Intelligence, and Machine Learning techniques
Support hiring and mentoring of junior team members
Collaborate with and contribute to the success of other teams and partners
Collaborate with internal groups and external partners to deliver next generation of innovation in trustworthy healthcare
Support and encourage experimentation and transparent, ethical scientific process in driving innovation
Key Qualifications
5+ years of experience in Applied Research in at least one of the following:
Machine Learning
Deep Learning
Natural Language Processing
Bachelor's degree in computer science or related STEM field
Professional experience developing production level algorithms, with a proven track record of successfully shipping applied research in production
Excellent problem solving and data analysis skills
Expertise in developing or applying predictive analytics, statistical modeling, data mining, or machine learning algorithms, especially at scale
Preferred Qualifications:
PhD degree in computer science or related STEM field
Experience building Natural Language Processing components in shipping products
Experience in adopting pre-trained models to new scenarios with additional structured/unstructured inputs
Experience in applying AI fairness, transparency, ethics and responsible AI processes and standards
Good written and verbal communication, including presentation skills
Key Differentiators: Grounded in a growth mindset, advocate for inclusion and diversity, and strong self-awareness
Why Truveta?
Be a part of building something special. Now is the perfect time to join Truveta. We have strong, established leadership with decades of success. We are well-funded. We are building a culture that prioritizes people and their passions across personal, professional, and everything in between. Join us as we build an amazing company together.
We offer:
Interesting and meaningful work for every career stage
Competitive compensation
Comprehensive benefits with strong medical, dental, and vision insurance plans
401K plan
Professional development & training opportunities for continuous learning
Work/life autonomy via flexible work hours and flexible paid time off
Generous parental leave
Regular team activities (virtual and in-person as soon as we are able)
Truveta is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and empowering workplace. We believe that having employees, interns, and contractors with diverse backgrounds enables Truveta to better meet our mission and serve patients and health communities around the world. We recognize that opportunities in technology historically excluded and continue to disproportionately exclude Black and Indigenous people, people of color, people from working class backgrounds, people with disabilities, and LGBTQIA+ people. We strongly encourage individuals with these identities to apply even if you don't meet all of the requirements.

Title: Data Scientist
Description: We offer a wide range of health, welfare and financial benefits including medical, wellness, dental and vision, 401(k), flexible spending and health savings…
Descriptions:
General Description: The Data Scientist will solve problems and answer questions designed to drive innovation and deliver organizational value. Title: Head of Data
Description:
Hire excellent data scientists, machine learning engineers, and engineering managers.
10+ years experience in data science, data analytics, and machine learning…
Descriptions:
About Us
Founded in 2017, Coalition combines cybersecurity and insurance to help organizations prevent digital risk before it strikes. Coalition's Active Insurance policies combine traditional coverage with a digital risk assessment and monitoring technology to help small and medium-sized businesses protect themselves in today's hyper-connected world.

The team at Coalition is made up of cybersecurity and technology experts, as well insurance industry veterans. Our secret sauce is bringing this expertise together to create a world-class organization with a massive technological advantage. Coalition is also backed by leading global insurers like Allianz, Arch Insurance, Lloyd's of London, Swiss Re and Zurich North America, Today, Coalition is one of the world's largest commercial insurtech serving over 160,000 customers.

In June 2022, Coalition closed an additional $250 million in Series F Funding to accelerate its rapid growth at a time when many other companies struggled to find funding. This latest funding validated that Coalition is building a long-term business that can deliver profitable growth with a clear strategic advantage.

Coalition has experienced tremendous growth by helping organizations of all sizes solve real-world problems and by remaining true to our founding values of character, humility, responsibility, purpose, authenticity and inclusion. We are proud to have been named among Inc.'s Best Workplaces of 2021 and one of Fast Company's most innovative companies for 2022.
About the Role
Coalition's mission is to protect the unprotected. To do this, we are reinventing an experience for organizations that helps them be secure in the uncertain world of digital risks. This means providing security at multiple levels: cyber, financial, and emotional through our innovative, end-to-end product suite. This product suite enables a new category that we are pioneering called Active Insurance. As the Head of Data Science at Coalition you will own our entire data platform and all of the ways that we derive value from it including analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.
Making effective and innovative use of our data is a fundamental pillar of our Active Insurance Strategy. Your organization will drive innovative end-to-end solutions from understanding our business requirements and historical data in the areas such as risk assessment, underwriting, and classification. You will collaborate closely with both engineering peers and business stakeholders. We are a human centric organization that is building for the long-term. We celebrate diversity and work hard to build a culture that is inclusive for all. Our culture is built around humility, purpose, authenticity, and responsibility. We have embraced distributed and remote work and our product and engineering teams are clustered in California, Washington, Colorado, Texas, and Portugal. Our ideal candidate will form insights and find innovative ways to meet current and evolving customer needs. We are looking for an experienced leader with a track record of successfully leading and growing a world-class data science and analytics organization.
Responsibilities
Build a world-class team. Hire excellent data scientists, machine learning engineers, and engineering managers. Mentor them and lay a clear growth path for your team
Develop our data science strategy and vision. Your goal is to drive impact across different aspects of our business through innovative use of data science and machine learning
Follow and share industry trends in data science and machine learning engineering
Deliver machine learning models into production. Operate your services at scale with high operational rigor
Create, enhance, and maintain technical documentation for all aspects of our data platform. Use this to drive engagement in the organization
Work with executive stakeholders across the company to help incorporate company goals and initiatives into the vision and plans for your area
Make Coalition a better place by modeling our cultural values and taking on the unseen, unforeseen, and important items that come up along the way
Skills and Qualifications
Computer Science or Engineering degree, or a related technical discipline, or equivalent work experience
10+ years experience in data science, data analytics, and machine learning
5+ years management experience and must have led a multi-team data science or machine learning engineering organization
Demonstrated success delivering and operating machine learning capabilities in production
Bonus Points
Prior fintech or insuretech experience
#LI-Remote
Why Coalition?
We're a highly fulfilling, mission-driven team who is committed to building a more diverse and inclusive culture. We want to work with people of all different backgrounds and paths in life, and we trust our team members to take responsibility, share ownership and put in the work, no matter how small the task. We are always looking for collaborative, inquisitive and dedicated individuals to join #OurCoalition and help us on our mission to solve digital risk.
Recent press releases:
To learn more, check out our featured press releases:
Coalition Closes $250 Million in Series F Funding, Valuing the Cyber Insurance Provider at $5 Billion
Coalition Named to Fast Company's Annual List of of the World's Most Innovative Companies for 2022
Coalition Launches Active Insurance, Reaches $650M Run Rate GWP
Coalition launches tech-powered executive risks products with personalized risk assessment for all US small-businesses
Coalition's very foundation is built on respecting and encouraging diversity and inclusion across the organization. We respect and encourage diversityCoalition is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Title: Staff Software Engineer, Machine Learning
Description: Build data processing pipelines, training pipelines, and hard example mining systems from production data streams.
Descriptions:
Standard AI has transformed retail as we know it. With the first autonomous retail solution that works in any existing store, we enable customers to walk in, grab what they need, and walk out - without waiting in line or stopping to pay. The company's computer vision solution is the only one that can be quickly and easily installed in retailers' existing stores, representing a giant leap forward for retail tech that enables retailers to rapidly deliver amazing new shopping experiences to customers. Standard has launched dozens of stores alongside Circle K, Compass Group, and others and have hundreds more on the way. We're the most well funded in our space, backed by some of Silicon Valley's leading investors including SoftBank, CRV, Initialized, EQT, Draper Associates, and Y Combinator.
We're building a soft real-time machine learning system that provides shoppers with a seamless checkout experience. Our system is vision only, and every store must stream process terabytes of video per day from hundreds of cameras, touching on a multitude of interconnected models. We're pushing the limits of what video comprehension can achieve, and we're expanding to do it at scale. You'll be helping us solve problems that few teams have ever tackled.

We're looking for someone passionate about engineering production-grade ML systems to help perfect and scale our product. This role is a unique opportunity to work at the cutting edge of delivering machine learning at scale, scaling out both massive training pipelines and high-throughput inference systems. Progress on improving these systems will have immediate impact on our shoppers and our business, and will have high visibility in the company.

As a successful MLE at Standard, you will design and build high-quality production inference systems that drive key impacts to our core business. All our ML Engineers contribute to the full life cycle of model development, from cross-functional data set acquisition, to training pipelines, to model design, to scaling out model serving and monitoring. If this sounds like fun, we'd love to hear from you!

This is a FULL TIME remote role located anywhere in the United States or the European Union.

What you'll do here:
Contribute to the end to end development of state of the art machine learning systems, from metric definition and data set creation to model deployment and monitoring
Solve modeling problems at the cutting edge of production machine learning
Work cross-functionally with operation teams in data creation and labeling to help design our massive data sets
Design and deploy monitoring, profiling, and instrumentation for the models you work on
Build data processing pipelines, training pipelines, and hard example mining systems from production data streams
Build and integrate the end to end lifecycle of large-scale, distributed machine learning systems using the latest open source technologies
Your skillset:
2+ years of experience building production ML or CV systems
4+ years of general engineering experience Experience working on building software systems in production
Proficient in Python and experience with least one systems language such as Rust, C++, or Java
Experience with cloud build, deployment, and orchestration tools
Proficient in at least one of the ML frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
You communicate clearly and possess the ability to work cross-functionally across team boundaries
You are able to problem solve in a flexible manner
You are passionate about the entire ML lifecycle


Only meet some of these traits or experiences? We'd still love to hear from you!

Why you might want to work with us:
We take care of you and your family with health, vision, and dental insurance.
You will have the option to contribute to a 401k.
You're excited to work on a product that will impact almost any consumer, almost anywhere.
Standard is a remote first company. We trust you to get your job done in the location that works best for you.
We dress casually. Some of us wear slippers in the office. In current work from home standings, we're super comfy.
We believe in a culture of learning, and want to keep building our skills, experiences, and capabilities.
We offer flexible work schedules. We trust our team to know how they will do their best work.
We're family friendly. We want our teammates to focus on what they need to when they need to.
We offer very competitive compensation, including equity in Standard, to each one of our employees.
Standard provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce and welcome people from all backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and abilities.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Pacify is looking for a motivated, dedicated and experienced Senior Data Analyst to use programming experience in Python and SQL in conjunction with analytical…
Descriptions:
In 2014, Pacify's co-founders launched the company after learning that for many families looking for breastfeeding support, the emergency department was the only place to go. Since then, we have built a network of more than 100 lactation consultants, doulas and maternal health experts who help new and expecting parents across the country take control of their health. And we're only getting started.
As a small company, team members are given autonomy to improve the products we deliver and contribute to our vision. We are a tech-minded, highly motivated, collaborative and fun team! You must have the desire to put in the time it takes to get the job done and help others achieve their goals, be eager to learn, and wear many hats.


Pacify is looking for a motivated, dedicated and experienced Senior Data Analyst to use programming experience in Python and SQL in conjunction with analytical skills to help develop new products, provide insights and highlight clinical outcomes in the form of reporting to our customers. Additionally, this role should supply data-driven direction to our clinical team. This position will report to the Assistant Vice President of Programs and Operations and will be responsible for developing and executing a logic based vision for our team. This role will be an opportunity to build analytic solutions to help better serve the families we support, as well as to be an evangelist / leader for our analytical capabilities.
Responsibilities:
Conduct statistical analysis of product, financial, and customer data to extract useful insights and recommendations to improve our products, business processes, and client experiences
Develop queries using SQL to aggregate and process data across multiple data sources
Create scheduled ETL pipelines / data workflows track key performance indicators
Create high visibility dashboards, as well as ad-hoc visualizations, to tell data stories
Develop and present automated reports both internally (Pacify team) and externally (partners) using a data design and sharing tool
Drive underlying data systems improvement by collaborating with business and engineering stakeholders
Manage multiple data projects (analysis, wrangling, and visualization) simultaneously
Be prepared to provide forecasting / predictive modeling ability
Minimum Qualifications
Proficient in SQL, and at least one programming language for statistical analysis (Python/R preferred)
Experience with Tableau, or other Business Intelligence (BI) tools; Looker and DataStudio experience are a plus+
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business Intelligence, Data Science, or related field of study
4+ years of experience performing data analysis, manipulation, and reporting results to customers/clients
Experience collaborating with both engineering and business teams
Ability to communicate effectively (both written and oral) and operate independently / in ambiguity
Exceptional organizational and time management skills with a demonstrated ability to prioritize tasks quickly and effectively based on changing needs to meet deadlines
Preferred Qualifications
Masters' degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics, Epidemiology, Public Health, or related field or a combination of education and experience which demonstrates the necessary skills and abilities required to succeed in data analysis
Experience working with healthcare claims data and a strong interest in healthcare related research, including HEDIS and CAHPS
Experience automating data workflows and maintaining/documenting code bases
The Team
Pacify is building a team of mission-driven, high-achieving, public health focused people! None of the above matters if we cannot attract, cultivate, and retain the best individuals.
Enjoy the flexibility to work wherever you would like while being supported by a compassionate, knowledgeable, and bi-coastal team!
Pacify values our employee team and wants to do everything to ensure that our team members are happy and professionally fulfilled, but also that they have the opportunity to be healthy. We are committed to providing a number of affordable and valuable health and wellness benefits to our employees, such as:
Unlimited paid time off
Medical, dental and vision insurance
FSA + HSA options
Company-paid life insurance
Company-paid Short-Term Disability
Long Term Disability and related insurance options
401k Plans with a company paid safe harbor match
Please note: If you are selected for further consideration, you will be subject to a background investigation. COVID-19 vaccination is a required condition of employment. Advantia Health, our parent company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to global diversity. Pacify values diversity and is constantly striving to build a team that reflects the broad, diverse patient populations we serve. If you believe your background, race, gender, or ethnicity positions you to help us toward that goal, please let us know.
