Title: Statistician
Description:
Present data at NIAID-sponsored meetings, and at domestic and international scientific meetings.
Prepare, data analysis of evaluation studies, materials to…
Descriptions:
Description:
JOB TITLE: Statistician
POSITION NUMBER: 2210-99999-STAT-01
POSITION LOCATION: Bethesda, MD
ANTICIPATED START DATE: As soon as possible
TRAVEL: As required to fulfill the responsibilities of the position
IHRC, Inc. provides scientific, information management, management consulting, bioinformatics, and administrative program support to the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and other Federal and private sector clients. The successful candidate will be a full-time employee of IHRC, Inc. and will be assigned to the Division of AIDS, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease (NIAID), at the National Institutes of Health (NIH), Bethesda, MD to provide statistical support for Mycobacterium tuberculosis Quality Assessment project.
SCOPE OF WORK
The Statistician will be part of a team of specialist scientists collaborating with User Groups and statisticians to evaluate and apply existing or novel statistical models for assessment, interpretation, and validation of MTB assay test results.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Develop quality control parameters for new assays as they are implemented in clinical studies.
Develop approaches for statistical analysis and interpretation of data from MTB assays. This must include at a minimum, methods for determination of detection limits or cut-off values; methods to evaluate precision, accuracy and linearity of quantitative assays; methods to evaluate and compare intra- and inter-laboratory variation; and methods to measure the effect of possible variations of assay performance parameters on precision, accuracy and linearity.
Develop plans for verification of assay performance specifications for implementation in Labs. For unmodified FDA-approved quantitative assays the verification must include analyses of accuracy, precision and linearity. For modified FDA-approved or non-FDA-approved assays, verification must also include analytical sensitivity and analytical specificity.
Prepare, data analysis of evaluation studies, materials to support preparation of scientific manuscripts for publication in peer-reviewed journals and submit these materials to the COR for review.
Present data at NIAID-sponsored meetings, and at domestic and international scientific meetings.
Requirements:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Education and Experience:
Master's or higher degree in statistics, mathematics, natural science, or a field related to the responsibilities of the position
2-3 years of experience in similar positions with similar duties and responsibilities
Required:
Extensive experience working with statistical software such as SAS, Stata, or similar software
Proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Skills and experience developing data visualizations, writing project reports, research protocols and manuscripts
Excellent attention to detail and the ability to efficiently organize multiple priorities
Documentation of daily work with good laboratory practice compliance
Ability to perform duties in compliance with local and federal quality systems
Ability to work and build coalitions with partners involved, and develop strategies for effectively conveying information to partners
Ability to work independently and yet to maintain the to respond to additional requests
Desirable:
Experience developing analytic methods and computational processes for the detection and quantification of bacterial antigens and antibodies reactive against specific components of infectious organisms.
Proficiency with MS Access
Programming skills in C++, Java, or Python
Experience with R
Experience working in a similar capacity in a Public Health setting

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description:
Experience leading data science teams and developing a data science practice.
Create patterns and practices that will shape our culture of data engineering and…
Descriptions:
About Us
We are a group of Technical Practitioners applying on the ground awesomeness to improve the technical capabilities and culture of our clients. To us agile is about putting people ahead of process to deliver value to our customers. With support from our leadership, our Technical Practitioners are empowered to make decisions at the work face to further the goals.
About You
We've found the best people often don't fit nicely into the molded narrative like your typical job description. You are a unicorn in a herd of horses: bringing your passion for technology, wells of knowledge & experience, humility to learn + share on our adventures, and some kindness + compassion.
The Work
Our goal is to build teams of highly skilled hands on practitioners who are passionate and get their hands dirty. You'll join an existing team of existing practitioners responsible for adding new features, maintaining existing solutions, and otherwise advising our teams on best practices. As a Principal, you are member of our leadership team of technologist and will provide strategic vision, and guidance into our technical delivery strategy.
Here are some of the areas we regularly work in:
Modern Software Delivery Patterns and Practices - We work with our clients to create new realities leveraging fit for purpose delivery techniques and patterns. As a Principal Developer, you will play a significant role in shaping the solution space as well as providing guidance to various members of the team with patterns and practices required for delivering cloud native solutions that meet the client needs.
Big Data - We aren't talking about "Big Data" as a buzz word, we mean, tons and tons of data. Our clients often have large data sets that require a refined understanding of various analytical models and techniques.
Quality Engineering - Our Data Scientists, just as our Software Developers, deliver high quality code using the principles of extreme programming.
Predictive Modeling - We often work with our clients to build products that allow them to get a better understanding of the core user/subject base to build solutions that add value.
Tooling
Qualified candidates should be experienced in Extreme Programming delivery practices including a thorough understanding of Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, and Pair Programming. We live in a Polygot engineering culture and often find that the best tool is the tool that can appropriately model the semantics of the problem space. Within our team, our Data Scientists often find them self working in python, coupled with various frameworks (mostly open source).
Responsibilities
Analyze large diverse data sets to understand the ideal modeling techniques for a given problem.
Provide strategic direction into opportunities to enrich product delivery through the application of data science techniques.
Create patterns and practices that will shape our culture of data engineering and data science through out the delivery lifecycle.
Apply agile approaches to Data Science deliverables.
Provide mentorship to members of our technical (and non-technical if interested) on the core tenants of data science.
Be a core contributor to our team.
Requirements
US Citizenship (does not include green card or work visa.)
Native or business-level spoken English proficiency.
Experience and Like to Haves
Minimum of 5 years working in Data Science Related Fields
Experience leading data science teams and developing a data science practice
Experience working with Structured and Unstructured Datasets
Experience working with Natural Language Processing Frameworks and Libraries
Python Development Experience Required

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Ads Sales (Remote)
Description: Improve the work of other data scientists through mentorship, tool development, and by bringing good industry practices to the team.
Descriptions:
[As of June 2020, Quora has become a "remote-first" company. This position can be performed remotely from multiple countries around the world. Please visit quora.com/eligible_countries for details regarding employment eligibility by country.]
About Quora:
The vast majority of human knowledge is still not on the internet. Most of it is trapped in the form of experience in people's heads, or buried in books and papers that only experts can access. More than a billion people use the internet, yet only a tiny fraction contribute their knowledge to it. We want to democratize access to knowledge of all kinds — from politics to painting, cooking to coding, etymology to experiences — so if someone out there knows something, anyone else can learn it. Our mission is to share and grow the world's knowledge, and we're building a world-class team to help us achieve this mission.
About the Team:
Unsurprisingly, then, the Data Team is highly empowered at Quora, helping navigate complexity and influencing product and company strategy directly. Quora's outsized commitment to data is visible in everything we do, from our rigor-driven experimentation processes to the backgrounds of our leaders (including many Product Managers and the Head of Product being former full-time data scientists). With this emphasis on data and empirics, we aim to balance rigor and pragmatism, searching for scrappy solutions in pursuit of our mission. In joining Quora's strong data team, you'll both benefit from and work to advance our culture of rational decision making.
About the Role:
As a data scientist in ads, you'll work closely with sales leadership, product managers, and engineers to devise appropriate measurements and metrics, build visualizations, design randomized controlled experiments, and tackle hard, open-ended problems that uncover usage patterns and opportunities for the company. In this role, you will deliver data-driven insights to guide our business strategy and extract untapped value in our platform by developing a deep understanding of our advertisers and users. Quora has a wide range of rich data, giving you ample room for exploration and creativity. For more about our work, see Quora's Data blog at https://quoradata.quora.com/.
Responsibilities:
Extract actionable insights from broad, open-ended questions to influence sales and product strategy and drive roadmap decisions
Analyze data to understand the root causes of metric movements and uncover growth opportunities
Design and evaluate A/B tests to make informed recommendations on product changes
Develop metrics and create dashboards to orient the direction of business development and track the success of the business
Communicate insights and recommendations to key partners
Improve the work of other data scientists through mentorship, tool development, and by bringing good industry practices to the team
Minimum Qualifications:
Ability to be available for meetings and impromptu communication during Quora's "coordination hours" (Mon-Fri: 9am-3pm Pacific Time). Learn why here
B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in a quantitative field
4+ years work experience in sales analytics, product analytics, or data science at a consumer tech company (e.g. open-ended analyses, metric development, A/B testing)
Proficiency in using SQL and procedural programming languages (e.g. Python, R) to manipulate and analyze data
Familiarity with theoretical foundations of statistical techniques (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression)
Demonstrated ability to exercise judgment and combine quantitative skills with intuition to translate numbers into insights
Demonstrated ability to clearly explain data results to cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience evangelizing best practices and process improvements on your team
Experience working with large data sets and distributed computing tools (e.g. Presto, Redshift)
Experience pushing code and navigating a complex codebase
Active Quora user with curiosity about the product
Additional Information:
For Colorado based applicants, the minimum salary range is $129,000 - $171,000 + equity + benefits. For California, New Jersey, and New York based applicants, the minimum salary range is $152,000 - $201,000 + equity + benefits. There are many factors that will determine the starting pay, including but not limited to experience, location, education, and business needs.
Quora offers a wide range of benefits including medical/dental/vision coverage, equity refreshers, remote work reimbursement, paid time off, employee assistance programs, and more. Benefits are country-specific and may vary.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) disclosure

Title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer Boston, MA or Remote Considered
Description: Healthcare, vision, and dental insurance plans (HMO or PPO), with voluntary add-ons available for dependent care, life, and accident coverage.
Descriptions:
Boston, MA or Remote Considered
PathAI's mission is to improve patient outcomes with AI-powered pathology. Our platform promises substantial improvements to the accuracy of diagnosis and the efficacy of treatment of diseases like cancer, leveraging modern approaches in machine learning. Rigorous science and careful analysis is critical to the success of everything we aspire to do. Our team, comprising of diverse employees with a wide range of backgrounds and experiences, is passionate about solving challenging problems and making a huge impact.
We're looking for experienced machine learning scientists to join our team and help solve some of these challenges.
What you'll do:
Understand PathAI’s products and services and introduce technology innovations with respect to functionality, performance, reliability, and scalability.
Design, develop and maintain the machine learning infrastructure that powers PathAI
Research and development of novel machine learning algorithms for the product platform
Research and development of machine learning algorithms to expand product capabilities
Participate in building new experiences, improve existing products, ensure quality assurance test designs and contribute to test systems architecture discussions
You will have the opportunity to work in a company culture that puts employees first, is relaxed but focused and hard-working. Every PathAI employee is a contributor to our mission to pioneer better patient care by providing the best, most innovative deep learning tools to biotech, pathologists, clinicians and healthcare organizations. You will work alongside and with leading innovators in the field of deep learning AI and medicine and you will play a critical role in algorithm development.
What you'll need:
To be successful in this role with us, you'll at least need:
MA or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science or related field required, preferably with a focus on artificial intelligence
At least four years plus of relevant work experience
Artificial intelligence software development experience using Python
Publications or research in fields related to artificial intelligence
Intellectual curiosity and the ability to learn quickly in a complex space
Benefits:
For the right candidate, we'll offer a competitive salary plus equity. Your compensation is rounded out by a strong benefits package:
Flexible work hours, with work-from-home options available
Three weeks of paid leave per year, an additional two weeks of sick time, plus extended holidays and team-approved leave
Ten days of 100% subsidized childcare per year
Healthcare, vision, and dental insurance plans (HMO or PPO), with voluntary add-ons available for dependent care, life, and accident coverage
Commuter benefit available for public transit or parking
Most importantly, you'll be doing important work with a team of people you'll genuinely enjoy spending the day with.
PathAI is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace that is free of harassment and discrimination. We base our employment decisions on business needs, job requirements, and qualifications — that's all. We do not discriminate based on race, gender, religion, health, personal beliefs, age, family or parental status, or any other status. We don't tolerate any kind of discrimination or bias, and we are looking for teammates who feel the same way.
PathAI does not accept unsolicited submissions from third-parties.
With the rise of employment phishing scams, especially during the current COVID-19 situation, we ask candidates to be extra vigilant. Be careful about providing any kind of personal information, such as location, age, or financial information to recruiters who may be impersonating PathAI employees. PathAI does not require payment for interviews or for applicants to purchase their own work supplies for reimbursement.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description: We leverage cross-disciplinary expertise in computational biology, bioinformatics, data science, engineering, statistics, and disease biology to ensure that we…
Descriptions:
At 2seventy, it's all about time – how you use your time to do meaningful work that matters, who you choose to spend your time with, and how we can give more time to our patients. When you join us, you are so much more than a number – we invite you to bring all of you and become part of a community where we believe we are better 2gether. Are you ready to re-think the (im)possible? Not only are we ready – we are doing it. The time is NOW.
This role can be Remote, based in Cambridge, MA or Seattle, WA
ABOUT THE TEAM
You will be an integral part of 2seventy's Data Sciences team within the interdisciplinary Data+Analytics Department, which is situated in Cambridge, Seattle, and remotely. We leverage cross-disciplinary expertise in computational biology, bioinformatics, data science, engineering, statistics, and disease biology to ensure that we learn everything we can from 2seventy's clinical trials and to ensure that truly transformative therapies reach our patients. We do this by collaborating extensively. Within Data+Analytics we collaborate with fellow data lovers from the Clinical/Biometrics, Manufacturing/Process Data, and Data Sciences Engineering teams; across 2seventy we collaborate with scientists from Oncology Research, Gene Editing, Preclinical & Translational Development, and Analytical Development.
Come work with us! We're a highly engaged, collaborative, and inquisitive group of data-obsessed individuals that can't help but rise to the challenge.
HOW YOU'LL SUCCEED
In this role, you will bring more TIME to cancer patients by supporting our early- and late-stage programs to accelerate progress across the cell therapy development pipeline.
For early programs, you will help identify promising cancer therapeutic targets and strategize how to pair them with novel potency enhancements, using both internal and public-domain genomic and immunological data resources.
For late programs, you will develop predictive models using clinical, drug product characterization, and molecular datasets to holistically understand patient responses and derive actionable insights.
Some key activities include:
Data mining to analyze and interpret molecular, immunological, preclinical, manufacturing, and clinical datasets.
Next-generation sequencing (NGS) analysis to support the engineering of active and specific gene-editing technologies.
Communicate results effectively within the team and to external collaborators of all levels and backgrounds.
Contribute to data and pipeline engineering efforts across research, clinical and manufacturing organizations.
Working with teammates in Data+Analytics to define and follow best practices in analysis, visualization, and data management.
Proactively brainstorming new ways data sciences can impact research and clinical projects.
Advocating for awareness, acceptance, and the adoption of advanced analytics and digital transformation across 2seventy.
WHAT YOU'LL BRING
A passion for diving deep into the data and science to improve the lives of cancer patients.
Demonstrated your ability to derive biological insights from complex genomic and/or immunological datasets.
A PhD in engineering, computational biology/bioinformatics, data science, computer science, biostatistics, or a related quantitative field and 4+ years of experience as a post-doc or in industry.
OR a Master's degree in above fields with 8+ years experience applying advanced analytical methods to high-dimensional datasets and communicating results to diverse audiences.
Expertise with R or Python and experience with Linux environments.
Prior experience working in cloud environment e.g., AWS.
Prior experience with next-generation sequencing data, such as bulk RNA-Seq, single-cell RNA-Seq, or WGS is required.
Prior experience working with publicly available biological databases.
Knowledge of core concepts in data science and applied statistics, such as model testing, regression, classification, and clustering methods.
A commitment to reproducible research.
Demonstrated yourself to be collaborative scientist who fosters open communication, mutual understanding, and cooperation between teammates.
Experience working on complex and dynamic projects, making decisions under uncertainty, and dealing with shifting priorities.
Prior experience in the fields of oncology, immunology, immunotherapy, or gene therapy is a plus, but passion for understanding the complex biological systems that give rise to the data is a must!
Strong curiosity about emerging trends in data sciences, genomics, computational biology, and bioinformatics and enthusiasm to bring new concepts and approaches to the team.
Bonus:
Prior experience with high dimensional flow cytometry (CyTOF) data.
Previous experience working with pipeline workflow languages (e.g. CWL, Snakemake, WDL, Nextflow) and with developing and maintaining docker containers.
Experience analyzing CRISPR or other genome editing screen datasets.
Prior experience analyzing clinical trial data.
2seventy bio has a mandatory vaccination policy for the COVID-19 vaccination for all employees, contractors and consultants as of January 4, 2022. In accordance with 2seventy bios duty to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of known hazards, we are adopting this policy to safeguard the health of our employees, contractors, consultants and their families, and the community at large from infections disease that may be reduced by vaccinations. Additional vaccinations beyond the Covid-19 vaccine may be added in the future.
Individuals seeking an exemption from this requirement for medical or religious reasons should complete a request for accommodation form and submit the form to the human resources department. 2seventy bio may consider several factors in assessing whether an exemption is available through an interactive process. All requests for an exemption will be evaluated on an individual basis.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Senior Client Data Analyst
Description: BENCHMARKING, INSIGHTS & TRENDS – Utilizes Acceleration Partners vast array of client and partner data to strategically and proactively analyze trends and…
Descriptions:
THE ROLE:
The Senior Client Data Analyst will sit within the Client Analytics team, while closely supporting the Client Services team. The ideal candidate will be highly driven with 5+ years of data analysis experience, within a performance marketing channel preferred. This person will be a centralized resource across the Client Services organization, helping to assist client teams in using data to improve strategy and storytelling. This role will also support internal client teams with complex data requests from clients with a focus on client retention, improvement of data/reporting scores on quarterly satisfaction surveys, telling a story with data to support the value of the channel, reprojections and more. This role will require the ability to use and analyze data for big picture strategic thinking while being able to succinctly make recommendations for the organization based on the information available. The Senior Client Data Analyst will also be responsible for proactive client and partner analysis across the organization, including producing benchmarking data and client facing reports to showcase the value of Acceleration Partners.
This role will utilize strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to compile and analyze complex data sets along with spot trends, flag anomalies and make recommendations based on data. The ideal candidate will be a visionary with a love of data and a knack for taking large data sets and analyzing it showcasing how data can be leveraged to tell a story. The candidate should have experience and be comfortable presenting in a group setting to internal stakeholders and to clients at varying levels. The candidate should possess superior organization and prioritization skills. Previous experience managing and motivating direct reports preferred.
Top 5 Job Responsibilities:
CENTRALIZED STRATEGIC ANALYSIS – Manages and prioritizes incoming complex data analysis requests from the Client Services team, with little to no guidance. Strategically and effectively completes data analysis projects such as using data to prove the value of the channel, creating re-projections, telling a story with data, conducting incrementality analysis and more. Pinpoints and proactively flags anomalies within the data that may impact program or partner performance. Proactively identifies and share ways to increase data efficiencies and improve data analysis across the delivery team. Reviews internal data and thinks creatively to pull together monthly strategic recommendations and takeaways for the organization based on the data available.
2. BENCHMARKING, INSIGHTS & TRENDS – Utilizes Acceleration Partners vast array of client and partner data to strategically and proactively analyze trends and benchmarking across the organization, creating reports and identifying insights to be shared with clients and prospects. Incorporates industry insights and benchmarks within reporting that are relevant to the client and support the story the data is telling. Supports internal teams with monthly Client Services update which includes big picture strategic recommendations, key learnings, and trends based on data. Creates client facing monthly deliverable showcasing trends and highlighting actionable key learnings while elevating Acceleration Partners as a continued thought leader.
3. CLIENT & INTERNAL COMMUNICATION – Clearly communicates and summarizes program and campaign performance, along with data learnings to internal stakeholders through various means including email recaps, PowerPoint presentations, 1-pagers and on internal facing calls across various levels. In addition, supporting account teams on client calls and during quarterly or annual presentations as needed. Showcases the ability to leverage large data sets to pull out key learnings and recommendations that can be presented in a concise and action-oriented format. Confidently presents data findings to client and internal teams in a formal setting or presentation that is clear and concise and easy for all stakeholders to understand.
4. PROJECT MANAGEMENT – Reviews and prioritizes incoming ad-hoc projects and support requests, developing a full understanding of the project scope and level of effort required to complete project. Balances and prioritizes projects based on time sensitivity and value to Client and AP. Communicates appropriate project plans and timelines for project completion to stakeholders.
5. LEAD, MANGE, & HOLD ACCOUNTABLE – Hold direct reports accountable to client deliverables and timelines, flagging areas of concern proactively. Coach direct reports, providing positive and constructive feedback on performance. Lead by influence through developing relationships and effectively communicating with clients and internal stakeholders across all departments and levels. Support internal team members with guidance and training around data analysis. Actively conducts quarterly training for internal team members on data analysis best practices and storytelling.
What Success Looks Like:
By 3 Months… The Senior Client Data Analyst will have a solid understanding of the important KPIs across the affiliate channel and will have started supporting various requests across the client teams as it relates to complex data analysis. This person can quickly make connections between data points to help identify cause/effect on performance and share actionable insights and recommended next steps with team members in support of making strategic recommendations to support client growth, satisfaction and retention. The Senior Client Data Analyst will be independently executing day-to-day project management across their areas of responsibility and is comfortable owning more complex ad hoc reporting deliverables with the outcome of increased thought leadership being shared with clients. This person has successfully reviewed internal data and used the information available to make strategic recommendations via the first monthly benchmarks and trending recap and shared out with the wider team for use.
By 6 Months… The Senior Analyst will be meeting expectations in their Top 5's with minimal guidance needed from their manager. This person is a vital part of the Client Analytics team providing strategic analysis, big picture thinking, and providing thought leadership as it relates to our data. This person is consistently supporting client teams in a centralized capacity by owning incoming support requests, including forecasting, and leveraging insights and benchmarks for storytelling with the outcome of increased client satisfaction, smarter decision making based on data and increased growth across our client portfolio. The Senior Client Data Analyst is consistently and proactively utilizing strong communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to compile and analyze large complex data sets with the outcome of providing clear, concise, strategic, deliverables for the client teams. The Senior Client Data Analyst is consistently delivering a monthly report to teams and clients showcasing key learnings from benchmarking and highlighting trends across our client portfolio. The Senior Analyst has refined their ability to analyze large data sets and compile takeaways into a monthly benchmarking and insights report that helps to support data backed recommendations across varying levels of the organization. This person is consistently participating in firm building which includes conducting quarterly data analysis training while sharing learnings and insights with peers and internal stakeholders which has the direct result of increased strategic decision making based on data leading to increased client happiness and retention. This person is consistently supporting client retention for at-risk clients and leveraging data to gain buy in from clients 50% of the time.
Qualities of Ideal Candidate:
Has strong internal motivation to get the job done and done well
Emphasizes incredible attention to detail and is capable of multi-tasking and independently owning several projects at once
Strong interest in data, spotting patterns and anomalies with a need to find the why
Excels at storytelling with data
Independently prioritizes competing objectives and manages time with skill
Possesses the ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Knows how to collaborate with team members in a remote environment
Displays superior written and verbal communication skills
Displays accountability, always meeting deadlines and keeping commitments
Thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys bringing order to chaos
Minimum Qualifications and Skills:
5+ years of data analysis experience, within a performance marketing channel preferred
Proven experience in data collection & analysis from multiple sources
Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including formatting, complex formulas, customization, etc.
Previous experience managing and motivating direct reports preferred
Superior communication and organization skills
Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Smartsheet experience a plus
Experience building PowerPoint decks and leading presentations to clients and internal stakeholders
Familiarity with Affiliate Networks and SaaS platforms (ShareASale, CJ Affiliate, Impact, etc.) a plus
Ability to travel when needed to conferences and meetings
Bachelor's degree or relevant work experience required
Location:
The Senior Associate, Data Analytics & Reporting is a remote, work from home position, as are all positions at Acceleration Partners (a structure central to our culture and our vision to change the work/life paradigm). Ideal candidates must reside within a reasonable driving distance of any of our key hub regions: Boston, New York City, Philadelphia, Chicago, Denver, Santa Barbara/Los Angeles, or Seattle. Limited travel may be required for internal meetings.
WHY ACCELERATION PARTNERS?
Founded in 2007, Acceleration Partners is the recognized leader in partnership marketing and a six-time Global Performance Marketing Award (GPMA) winner in the "Best Affiliate and Partner Marketing Agency" category. Acceleration Partners manages programs in 40+ countries for more than 170 brands including Target, GoToMeeting, Noom, ButcherBox, and Betterment. Acceleration Partners' fully remote global staff of 300+ maintains a singular focus on delivering exceptional outcomes; and delivers deep and data-driven expertise in all key partnership marketing tactics, including affiliate, influencer, content, mass media, and B2B partner marketing. In addition, Acceleration Partners has received awards for its performance and exceptional culture, including "Best Agency" and "Best Team in Performance Marketing ("Performance Marketing Awards"), US Changemakers ("PerformanceIN"), "Best Workplaces" (Inc.), "Best Places to Work" (Glassdoor), and "Most Committed to Work-Life Balance" (Digiday).
Learn more about Acceleration Partners at https://careers.accelerationpartners.com/.

AP PERKS & BENEFITS - WHAT WE OFFER
100% remote work for everyone
Group medical, dental, and vision coverage insurance (with opt-out benefits)
401K with matching
Open Paid Time Off
Summer & Holiday company-wide wellness breaks
Volunteer and Birthday Time Off
Focus Fridays
Paid Parental Leave Benefits
Wellness, Technology & Education Allowances
Annual AP Summit all company meeting
Paid sabbatical leaves, donation matching, and more!!
Benefits may vary based on employment status or country location.

Acceleration Partners is committed to having a diverse and inclusive culture. We would particularly welcome applications from black, Asian and other ethnic minority backgrounds, LGBTQ candidates, and candidates with a disability or who are neurodivergent.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Lead analytics projects to monitor the health of our business and solve a wide range of business problems to inform data-driven strategic and operational…
Descriptions:
The Black Tux is reinventing formal wear so people can show up at their best on the days that matter most. We design and manufacture modern rental suits and tuxedos that actually fit—made of 100% wool, ordered online, and delivered for free.

As a member of the Data & Analytics team, you will become the company expert on data. Our data is key to the company’s ability to live up to our mission to provide our customers with concierge level service and you will be an integral part of ensuring we succeed. You will work on a variety of projects across the company from forecasting future inventory demand and building out an accurate source of truth on inventory stock, to ensuring we can fulfill every order, to working with our stakeholders and defining key metrics and visibility for performance management. You will work with stakeholders across the business to help them make smarter, data driven decisions and inform company-wide strategy as we continue to grow.
What You'll Do
Lead analytics projects to monitor the health of our business and solve a wide range of business problems to inform data-driven strategic and operational decisions
Work closely with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions
Communicate directly with stakeholders to understand the business, project requirements, and to better ideate analytical solutions
Define KPIs, develop and own business intelligence dashboards, and provide ongoing tracking and insights to partners
Build and improve advanced analytical models, such as our inventory size predictions and shipment forecasting, to allow team to be forward looking in identifying and solving potential inventory shortages
Collaborate with data engineering to ensure that we have accurate sources of truth data to serve needs across our organization
Engage stakeholders and leadership to identify obstacles and implement data analytics and tools to help improve their day-to-day business decisions and operations
Who You Are
4+ years analyzing data in a small or mid-size company
Empathetic analyst that thrives as a true partner to business stakeholders and understanding their needs, building strong relationships to achieve the shared goal of using analytics and insights to drive the business forward
Problem solver that is excited to take on new challenges and, given context, being self-directed and enthusiastic about owning your work autonomously
Storyteller that uses data visualization to communicate insights effectively to a variety of stakeholders; Tableau experience is a plus
Strong understanding of business statistics, forecasting and predictive analytics
Use SQL daily to help companies understand their operations and make data-driven decisions, preferably with experience working internally with warehouse, inventory, and/or customer care data
Knowledge of Python and/or R for in depth analyses
Shows modesty, kindness and support to your team and the people you work with
Bonus points for experience with similar data stacks and tools: Highjump, Snowflake, dbt, Tableau
Benefits and Perks of Working at The Black Tux
We pay people equally and based on market compensation data
We provide a 401(k) plan through Betterment
Our full-time employees receive stock options and have a stake in the company
Our Health, dental and vision plans are competitive, and we cover 100% of employee coverage and 50% of dependents
Open vacation time
Monthly cell phone reimbursement
TBT Women’s Group
TBT Diversity and Inclusion Group
Paid maternity and paternity leave
Apple equipment or whatever you need to be productive
Monthly employee events and trainings
Free suit rentals
We're an equal opportunity employer to all. We interview and hire applicants of all backgrounds, orientations, expressions, and identities.

Our people are the most important asset to us. Our benefits, perks, pay and culture reflect this in every decision we make. If you want to learn more about us, check out our Culture Book.

Title: Senior Survey Research Data Analyst
Description: You will provide data-driven insights through survey data analysis and data visualization - focusing on brand awareness and customer experience.
Descriptions:
Remitly is on a mission to transform the lives of immigrants and their families by providing the most trusted financial products and services on the planet. We strive daily to meet our promise to our customers by building peace of mind into everything we do. The quantitative insights you bring will have an impact on our customers around the world. You will provide data-driven insights through survey data analysis and data visualization - focusing on brand awareness and customer experience. You will report to the Senior Researcher, Consumer Insights. This role is flexible to be based in Seattle or remote in the U.S.
You Will:
Analyze and visualize data – including customer survey data, third-party data, and internal customer data
Create automated data pipelines from raw data to dashboards, allowing for longitudinal tracking
Gain familiarity with research process, including: questionnaire development, programming, fieldwork, incentives, and analysis
Participate in Remitly's broader Analyst Guild
Prepare tables, cross tabs, charts, and results slide decks
You Have:
5+ years analytics experience
2+ years of experience working with survey data
Bachelor's Degree in Analytical or Business Field
High empathy for customers and research participants
Analytic skills, including an ability to use statistical programs or packages to analyze large amounts of data (correlations, regressions, conjoint)
Expertise in SQL, Excel (can perform complex functions) , or Google Sheets, GitHub
Experience with data visualization and related tools (e.g., Tableau, Periscope)
Experience with SPSS, STATA, or R
Our Benefits:

Health, dental, and vision benefits + 401k plan with company matching
Company contributions to your HSA or FSA plan, if you choose one
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) available for eligible employees
Continuing education and corridor travel benefits

Title: Senior Data Scientist (Remote)
Description:
You’ve built models and interpret results from a variety of statistical/machine learning/data science techniques.
Experience with deep learning models.
Descriptions:
If you are a Senior Data Scientist with experience in IoT or complex software environments, we are looking for you to join our Data & Computer Vision team to analyze, process, and model data to answer exciting new questions for Spacee and our customers. The ideal candidate is adept at using a variety of data methods, data tools & programming languages, building & implementing models, using/creating algorithms, and displaying results in a visually explainable and informative manner. If you are humble, confident, transparent, and have a knack for developing and iterating Data Science solutions, then we’d like to meet you.

Top Reasons to Work with Us:

Spacee is a data company that does groundbreaking work in the Computer Vision, Augmented Reality, and Inventory Management industries. Our Data & Computer Vision group develops outputs that get shared directly with our customers! Our Data Science group is developing; so, there is a lot of opportunities for you to make a high impact.

This is a remote (US-based only) opportunity. It is expected from the candidate to be able to work in Central Time.

What you will be doing:

You will work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
You will mine and analyze data from company sources, manipulate data sets, develop custom data models and algorithms, and work with our Data & Computer Vision team to promote these solutions.
You will use data summarization and visualization techniques to display results as well as appropriate KPI metrics as needed.

Core Responsibilities:

Take lead on any initial data investigation and exploratory data analysis.
Develop processes for manipulating data, modeling data, and optimizing data to draw conclusions.
Measure and test your results to gain feedback, gain insight, and make improvements.

About You:

You are self-motivated with strong project management and organizational skills. You can’t just execute on work planned by others. Your expertise means we want you to identify the work that needs to be done and to propose it clearly and convincingly.
You have solid written communication skills and an interest in writing clear documentation.
You have strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
You enjoy learning, researching, mastering, and implementing innovative approaches and technologies. But you temper your enthusiasm with a clear-eyed evaluation of opportunity costs and the value of implementation relative to the implementation cost.
You enjoy using your creativity to frame problems in different angles and discover how things can be operated differently to generate new insights.
You gain satisfaction from helping other people and enjoy open-minded collaboration with various stakeholders and team members to explore new solutions.

Required Qualifications:

Fluent in Python or R.
Strong analytical skills related to drawing insights from various data sets.
4+ years of experience in a Data Science role, or equivalent.
You’ve transformed, mitigated missingness, identified problems with, and characterized the real interpretations of data from imperfect production data systems.
You’ve used programming languages to manipulate, visualize, and analyze data to produce actionable insights.
You’ve built models and interpret results from a variety of statistical/machine learning/data science techniques. You can choose between different models to address a problem and can explain the real-world tradeoffs involved in selecting between them.

At least two of:

Comfort with various data definition and manipulation languages, particularly SQL.
Comfort with acquiring data from data lakes, data warehouses, databases, and streaming sources.
Experience with distributed data/computing tools.
Experience with deep learning models.
Familiar with testing and packaging Python or R
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.
Experience with Cloud services; we use Azure.
Experience using APIs to retrieve or pass data.

Nice to haves:
Experience with Ensemble Models, Generalized Linear Models, or Nonparmetric Regression

What's In It for You:

Opportunities for learning and career development

So, if you are interested in a Senior Data Scientist position at Spacee, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.
Spacee, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are not accepting resumes from agencies. No fees will be earned unless authorized for this specific search.

iCatalyst, Inc. is an agile solution-oriented business and technology solutions company serving as a trusted partner and advisor to multiple federal and commercial customers since 2007. STEM degree from an accredited university.

Descriptions:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.
Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims, provider, member, and encounters data. Identify and assess the business impact of trends

Contribute to the planning and execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership

Partner cross-functionally at all levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners
Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results
Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required

Provider

Quality
Experience with HEDIS, NCQA, Medicare Star Rating System, QRS, or other quality measures preferred; Quality auditing or analysis of call center performance preferred; Experience with data mining, population health, and statistical modeling preferred

ICON plc is a world-leading healthcare intelligence and clinical research organisation. From molecule to medicine, we advance clinical research providing outsourced services to pharmaceutical, biotechnology, medical device and government and public health organisations.
With our patients at the centre of all that we do, we help to accelerate the development of drugs and devices that save lives and improve quality of life.
Our people are our greatest strength, are at the core of our culture, and the driving force behind our success. ICON people have a mission to succeed and a passion that ensures what we do, we do well.
The Role:
Responsible for providing support to Manager
Responsible for leading programmes of work and programming teams or individual projects of all types.
Responsible for the planning and performing of programming activities according to business SOPs and sponsor requirements.
Responsible for all aspects of quality and compliance of assigned projects.
Drive efficiency through standards, automation, process improvement and technological advances.
Drive efficiency through resource, time line and project management.
Responsible for generation of documentation and SAS code required and generation of report tables, listings, figures and datasets.
Act as study lead for a project to coordinate all study activities.
Ensure projects are conducted in accordance with internal SOPs, client requirements, and Good Clinical Practices (GCP).
Review and provide input to project documentation as appropriate including reviewing statistical analysis plans and CRF’s.
Understand project scope and budget.
Carry out quality control checks to ensure compliance with Company and Sponsor requirements.
Ensure accuracy of all results and ensure appropriate documentation.
Prepare graphs, tables and listings for inclusion in clinical study reports.

Provide input to the appraisal process for staff support projects or mentorees.

Possess excellent written and oral communication skills
Experienced with macros and arrays for repetitive tasks

Title: Manager, Data Science
Description:
Experience with healthcare data, ideally clinical/operational clinical trial data.
The suite of applications built on the platform allows study teams to…
Descriptions:
About Lokavant
Lokavant is a clinical intelligence platform that improves the time, cost, and quality of trial execution through data-driven analytics applications. Lokavant's platform aggregates and integrates real-time data from disparate trial data sources, and powers advanced analytics enabled by its compendium of proprietary trial data. The suite of applications built on the platform allows study teams to proactively manage their studies, and surfaces insights, driving efficiencies in all scientific and operational use cases. For more information, please visit www.lokavant.com.
About the Opportunity
How often are you given the opportunity to build something from the ground up, with an abundance of resources at your disposal; to be part of a team of people accomplished in diverse scientific and engineering disciplines, focused on using the best of what lies at the forefront of technology to address complex, real-world problems that have a positive impact on potentially millions of peoples' lives? This is that kind of opportunity.
Now more than ever, improving the speed and reducing the cost of drug development is a top priority for the biopharma and healthcare industry. At Lokavant, we're leveraging our unique dataset and advanced analytics to do just that. We are seeking a thoughtful, hands-on, and output-oriented manager of data science with an aptitude for or strong interest in clinical trial data to join the rapidly growing Data Science team. Working closely with other departments such as Engineering, Product, Customer Success, and Commercial teams, you will use our one-of-a-kind trial dataset to build modern, tech-enabled trial delivery products, powered by your predictive models. Data Science is a key competency at Lokavant, so you will be instrumental in setting and executing upon the vision for Lokavant's differentiation in the clinical research industry.
Key Responsibilities
Design, build, test and integrate your predictive models into our product offerings
Work with data, such as data cleaning, transformation, extraction, and loading (ETL), to prepare datasets for further analysis and modelling
Perform exploratory data analysis, evaluate datasets for business values, and produce easy-to-understand visualizations highlighting key insights
Develop tools to enable scalable practices across the growing Data Science team; such as model and query optimization, re-usable internal libraries, and process improvements
Use a variety of machine learning techniques to solve product focused business problems.
Take an active role in defining the development roadmap and deliverables for the Data Science team in an integrated agile product development process
Coach and lead a team of data scientists and analysts, provide guiding and coaching while delivering data science enabled solutions
Work in a small team setting partnering with engineers and scientists to derive the insights needed to support our products and product features, including informing our Commercial strategy
Mentor and be mentored by colleagues of varied experience levels and subject matter areas
Minimum Requirements
Ability to bring data science into action; for example, discover relevant research papers and implement the key ideas from the paper into working models
Experience with Bayesian models and applying statistical models for solving real world business problems
High proficiency in Python and SQL
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Experience building data models, and a solid understanding of the "modern data stack"
Strong attention to detail and highly organized, with effective multi-tasking and prioritization skills
Ability to work as part of a collaborative cross-functional team in a fast-paced environment
3+ years of relevant experience in an analytical role involving data science and statistical modeling
Master's degree or above with strong academic performance in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or equivalent fields
Preferred (Nice-to-have) Qualifications
Experience in the life sciences industry
Experience with healthcare data, ideally clinical/operational clinical trial data
Knowledge of clinical data standards (e.g. CDISC, FHIR, HL7, etc.)
Knowledge of e-clinical systems and technologies (e.g. EDC, CTMS, IRT, etc.)
Experience with Looker, Tableau or other BI visualization tools
Salary Range: $140,000 - $160,000
Employee Benefits
Competitive salary and annual performance bonus
Full medical, dental, and vision benefits, including mental health and telehealth
Employee stock options
Free membership to One Medical
401(k) retirement savings plan with company match
Flexible paid time off policy
Flexible remote work policy
Generous paid parental leave policy
Short and long-term disability insurance
Basic and supplemental life and AD&D insurance
Health Advocate program
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Healthcare & dependent care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Discounts on auto, home, and pet insurance
Commuter benefits
Great NYC office located in the heart of Times Square
Team-building events and outings
Learning and professional development opportunities
Employee referral program

AFL provides industry-leading fiber optic products, conductor accessories and fittings, and related services across the globe. The position plays a critical role in identifying opportunities to add business value, pursue easier ways to access information, and drive the maximum level of standardization of reporting and Analytics across the entire corporation. Responsibilities

Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to analyze business requirements to determine processing flows, user requirements, and inter-dependencies between multiple information systems
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to analyze and break down a problem to isolate the root cause
Solid understanding and experience in data management practices including data profiling, data quality assessment, and Master Data Management
Ability to analyze data and create business rules in matching merging of data
Ability to write SQL’s; Understanding of procedures a big plus

Experience documenting and communicating designs aligned to business requirements
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Personal Attributes
Team player – comfortable in a cross-functional and multi-cultural environment
Project Management Skills – Ability to break requirements down to finite scope, and break it into understandable chunks for both consultants and in-house development teams to deliver
Interpersonal skills – a confident communicator with good oral and written communication skills, needed to work with internal and external customers and suppliers to understand the business requirements; able to explain solutions in a non-technical way.
Initiative – a self-starter who strives to achieve even in the most challenging environment
Ability to work in a fast changing and sometimes ambiguous environment, identifying key priorities and driving innovative solutions.
Ability to work independently; strong motivation and initiative to identify and do what needs to be done
Ability to build a sense of trust and rapport ha creates a comfortable and effective work environment

Descriptions:
With a focus on Mobility, Operational Excellence, Value to our Customers and the Electrification of vehicles, you can expect to be part of something exciting. From the sleek design of our vehicles to the unique opportunities we offer around the globe, Nissan exemplifies ingenuity in everything we do. Our people are what drive the business forward.

We are currently looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our team in Franklin, TN (Hybrid) or Remote anywhere in US.

The role will be responsible for leading the work team’s investigation of processes, technology, cost, and strategy while identifying options for improving and bridging the needs of the Aftersales DataMart (ADAM) with the use of Information Systems and Technology. A Senior IS Analyst is responsible for leading the team’s analysis of and approving the documentation of Information Systems needs of clients to help identify problems and propose solutions.

Job functions Include but are not limited to:
The Senior IS Analyst is an internal consultancy role that is responsible for leading the work team’s investigation of processes, technology, cost, and strategy while identifying options for improving and bridging the needs of the business with the use of Information Systems and Technology. An IS Senior Analyst is responsible for leading the team’s analysis of and approving the documentation of Information Systems needs of clients to help identify problems and propose solutions.
The Senior IS Analyst role is to liaise with the internal business departments and the providers of services to the enterprise as well as potentially guide/manage other analysts in this capacity.
The Senior IS Analyst will lead the analysis in resolving incidents as they occur by working with multiple third-party vendors to ensure maintenance and support is carried out effectively among all parties.
The Senior IS Analyst must understand, interpret and suggest resolution to technical systematic issues and communicate these issues effectively to management and peers.
The Senior IS Analyst scope of analysis includes all functions within several domains, including cross-functional and cross-regional and global business functions.
As necessary, perform any other relevant duties across different functional areas across regionally and globally to aid in the success of the organization.

Qualifications:
7+ years overall IS/IT experience with a combination of application development and/or systems architect experience and experience working with third party vendors. Prior experience working with offshore personnel is a plus
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience or certifications/technical diploma. Advanced technical degree preferred
Excellent verbal and written skills in local language + proficient verbal and written skills in English
Mastery of the following concepts: Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, ETL, Data Management Strategies, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning
Thorough understanding of project management methodologies including, but not limited to, Waterfall, Scrum and Kanban
Experience with the following products and tools: Informatica, AWS, Snowflake, Jira, Confluence
AWS Certifications are desired but not required
Must be flexible and possess the ability to adapt to changing priorities and a flexible workday. May be required off work schedule to meet deliverables or respond to on-call urgent inquiries.
Ability to use analytical skills to understand the organization and its functions, which helps them to identify opportunities and to analyze and solve problems while leading efforts using agile skills to quickly drive concepts from requirements to market delivery. Also must possess management skills to manage projects, resources, risk, and change.
Communication skills to collaborate and influence Business Users, Programmers, and other IT/IS Teams and Professionals. Strong ability to lead efforts to interpret complex business requirements and drive technical solutions, while negotiating conflict and building consensus. Possess effective communication skill to Directors (IS & business).
Experience with eliciting requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task, and workflow analysis. Also must have strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: (Functional requirements (Business Requirements Document), Use Cases, GUI, Screen, and Interface designs, develop, monitor, and conduct application testing)

Welcome to an open lane of possibility. Drive your career forward and join the company leading the technology and business evolution of the automotive industry by applying today.

Nissan is committed to a drug-free workplace. All employment is contingent upon successful completion of a drug screen for roles based in the United States and background screening for all positions.

All of us at Nissan – regardless of functional area or expertise – share a passion to design, manufacture, and sell high-performance vehicles. It is Nissan’s policy to provide Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, gender, military status, disability, or any other status protected by law. Candidates for this position must be legally authorized to work in the United States and will be required to provide proof of employment eligibility at the time of hire; Nissan uses E-Verify to validate employment eligibility. **Visa sponsorship for this position is not available at this time.**

NISSAN FOR EVERYONE

People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. When everyone belongs, the power of NISSAN is undeniable. Our Corporate Diversity Initiative aims to improve business results by ensuring that our workplace and core businesses meet the unique needs of our employees and customer base.

Nissan is committed to creating a culture where everyone belongs and employees, customers, and partners feel respected, valued, and heard. We have over 10 Business Synergy Teams (BSTs) across the U.S. and Canada that connect employees – with shared characteristics or interests – build allies, and foster a company culture where all employees feel supported and included.

Nissan also values inclusion in all areas of our business as we strive to mirror the diversity of our customer base and the communities where we do business. We are committed to procuring innovative goods and services, retailing our products and communicating from a diverse perspective which will help us continue to offer our customers competitively designed, market-driven products.

Join us as we carry our commitment to diversity and inclusion into the future.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Modeling)
Description: This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on…
Descriptions:
Company Description

It all started with an idea at Block in 2013. Initially built to take the pain out of peer-to-peer payments, Cash App has gone from a simple product with a single purpose to a dynamic app, bringing a better way to send, spend, invest, borrow and save to our millions of monthly active users. With a mission to redefine the world's relationship with money by making it more relatable, available and accessible, at Cash App you'll have the opportunity to make a real-world impact with your career.
Remote Work
Today, Cash App has thousands of employees around the world with a culture geared toward creativity, collaboration and impact. We’ve been a distributed team since day one, and continue to value working across time zones and continents both remotely and in our Cash App offices.
Our offices are great, but many of our roles can be done remotely from the countries where Block operates. We tailor our experience to champion our employees’ creativity and productivity wherever they are.

Job Description

Machine Learning is an integral part of how we design products, operate, and pursue Cash App’s mission to serve the unbanked as well as disrupt traditional financial institutions. Our massive scale and deep trove of transaction data create an endless number of opportunities to use artificial intelligence to better understand our customers and offer new products and experiences that can improve their lives. We are a highly creative group that prefers to solve problems from first principles; we move quickly, make incremental changes, and deploy to production every day.
This role is part of our Cash App's ML team and will be deeply embedded within one of our product teams - here are the workstreams we're currently hiring for:
Search & Discovery
Cash App enables millions of people and businesses to pay and get paid with ease. On this team, you will build delightful experiences that help our customers find and discover people and things quickly and with trust - we aim to grow and strengthen the connections between people and businesses across the globe. Through your work, you will empower Cash App to personalize customers’ search and discovery experiences using AI/ML, to better understand our customers’ payment journeys, and help identify and execute on new opportunities for product improvement. You will employ a variety of modeling techniques on our comprehensive customer data and scale your solution to production by partnering closely with design, product, analytics, and engineering teams.
Recommendations + Incentives
We provide an ML-powered recommendation services platform that works for the entire gamut of our Product Abstractions and enables Cash to make creative and personalized customer experiences. Furthermore, our ML models used for incentives programs consistently provide value to the business and our customers by attracting and engaging more customers which directly contributes to the massive success of Cash.
Risk
You'll build machine learning models that detect fraudulent activity in real time and help keep our customers safe and secure. You will experiment with state-of-the-art algorithms to drive down false positives, collaborate on new product features to drive fraud losses down, use any and every dataset at your disposal (including 3rd party data) to engineer new features for risk models, verify customer documents using OCR, and use biometric and device signals to detect malicious logins and account takeovers.
Risk AI
We are a group aimed at developing deep learning based signals and learned representations for Risk ML models. Currently, Risk @ Cash ML models are predominantly based on tabular supervised tree-based models. Our team has the mandate to explore and implement alternatives based on SOTA neural network architectures and techniques. This is a particularly exciting time to join as you will be part of the first members of the team, and will have the opportunity to shape our roadmap.
Customer Support Automation
We aim to create better-than-human Customer Support Experiences. Cash App holds people’s money, and building customers’ trust is absolutely essential to our brand. Providing fast and reliable help whenever the customer needs it is a major component of building that trust. You will build models that anticipate customer issues and deliver proactive in-app suggestions, use NLP to contextualize inquiries and respond instantly with relevant content, develop prioritization algorithms that improve efficiency, and apply the latest research to automate conversations with customers.
Underwriting and Credit
Our mission is to redefine credit and liquidity through simple, fair, and accessible credit solutions that build financial health and resilience. This team builds and integrates ML solutions for evaluating customer cash flow risk including risk of default on credit obligations, risk of fraud & abuse of loans and other situations where Cash app advances funds or provides liquidity to customers. We support multiple products across 4+ workstreams in Cash. Through your work you will empower the team to understand the financial performance of origination cohorts, optimize our automated decisioning pipeline using AI/ML, and help identify new opportunities for growth in our customer base. You will experiment with various modeling techniques on our comprehensive customer data and see your solution through to production by partnering cross-functionally with finance, product, and engineering teams.
Technologies we use (and teach):
Python (NumPy, Pandas, sklearn, xgboost, TensorFlow, keras, etc.)
MySQL, Snowflake, GCP/AWS and Tableau
Java

Qualifications

You have:
5+ years experience with applied Machine Learning or Deep Learning
A graduate degree in Computer Science, AI, ML, Applied Math, Stats, Physics, or a related technical field
Worked with Product, Design, and Engineering to prioritize, scope, design, and deploy ML models
A track record of providing mentorship and technical leadership
An appreciation for the connection between the software you build and the experience it delivers to customers

Additional Information

Block takes a market-based approach to pay, and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.

Zone A: USD $167,300 - USD $204,500
Zone B: USD $158,900 - USD $194,300
Zone C: USD $150,600 - USD $184,000
Zone D: USD $142,200 - USD $173,800
To find a location’s zone designation, please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed, please speak with a recruiter for additional information.
Benefits include the following:
Healthcare coverage
Retirement Plans including company match
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Wellness programs, including access to mental health, 1:1 financial planners, and a monthly wellness allowance
Paid parental and caregiving leave
Paid time off
Learning and Development resources
Paid Life insurance, AD&D. and disability benefits
Perks such as WFH reimbursements and free access to caregiving, legal, and discounted resources
This role is also eligible to participate in Block's equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies, and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time, consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.
We’re working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity, and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
We believe in being fair, and are committed to an inclusive interview experience, including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter, who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we’re doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.
Additionally, we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team, assessing candidates in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
Block, Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square, Cash App, Spiral, TIDAL, and TBD, we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions, business software, and banking services. With Cash App, anyone can easily send, spend, or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free, open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.

Title: Consultancy – Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher, Accelerator Lab Network
Description: Ability to meet deadlines, work under pressure, manage workflows, and operate as part of a distributed team with members across almost every time-zone on the…
Descriptions:
Background
The UNDP Accelerator Labs Network is the largest learning network in the world. It includes 91 public innovation labs and a global curation team, all embedded within UNDP’s global architecture and country platforms.
Each lab surfaces and reinforces locally sourced solutions to development challenges, and mobilizes a wide and dynamic range of partners who contribute knowledge, resources, and experience. The goal is to transform traditional development approaches by introducing new protocols, backed by evidence and practice, to accelerate the testing and dissemination of solutions within, and across countries, while at the same time enabling the global community to collectively learn from local knowledge and ingenuity at a speed and scale that our societies and planet require.
To support these learning outcomes, the UNDP Accelerator Labs global team is building a Network Learning Strategy and Prototype for knowledge management. The strategy has a strong digital component, that builds on the idea of “going where the information is”. The goal is to facilitate the detection of “where” knowledge is held in the network, and “why” it can be assumed to be held there, rather than trying to capture, infer, or extrapolate precisely “what” that knowledge is. This requires “listening” to the activities of the network, by centralizing and making sense of the content the labs put out, as well as the digital traces they leave behind as they conduct their work.
The Network Learning Prototype pulls together these unstructured data mainly text from various sources, including conversations on WhatsApp and Teams, blogs published on UNDP Country Office websites and Medium, and internal reporting feeds. While it is hardly big data, the volume is reaching a point where automation is becoming necessary to detect latent topics and trends that emerge from the network, and to structure and map open-ended taxonomies. The NLP researcher will work on this directly with the Lead Data Scientist of the UNDP Accelerator Labs global team.
The purpose of this procurement exercise is to contract an individual consultant who will work with the lead Data Scientist of the UNDP Accelerators Labs global team on a novel knowledge management pipeline that pulls together unstructured data (mainly text) from various sources including conversations on WhatsApp and Teams, blogs published on UNDP Country Office websites and Medium, and internal reporting feeds and computationally looks for latent topics and trends that emerge from the work being conducted across the network of Accelerator Labs. The main objective of the consultancy will be to improve the topic modeling component of the pipeline.

Duties and Responsibilities
OF WORK, RESPONSIBILITIES AND DESCRIPTION OF THE PROPOSED ANALYTICAL WORK
Explore word and sequence embedding techniques to improve an early prototype for structuring open-ended, multi-language taxonomies.
Design, build, and evaluate topic models and more recent BERT-based zero-shot classifiers in Python for the Network Learning Prototype—primarily in English, but ideally also in French, Spanish, Portuguese, and Arabic.
Collaborate with different teams across UNDP to build a corpus of sustainable development-related documents, presumably in multiple languages, and fine-tune language models using this corpus.
Work with the Lead Data Scientist and the Full Stack Developer to take useful models and classifiers to production and integrate them into a suite of UNDP Accelerator Labs online tools and platforms.
Conduct occasional text analyses for the Accelerator Labs Network global team.
Document the work produced.
Expected outputs and deliverables:
#

Number of working days
Target Due Dates
% of payment
